trends: There have been 158 other sightings in Portland
There were no other sightings in Portland on or around September 8th 2009
Summary: two objects fly over head, slowly dim and fade out
divs: sighting detailsnot sure if this was a ufo or not, but neither myself nor the person i was with could come up with a reasonable explanation for what we saw so we classified this event as a ufo sighting. i walked outside to get my backpack from my car while my friend was out letting her dogs goto the bathroom. i stood outside her finishing my cigarette, when i was staring at the stars (it was a pretty clear night). i watched a plane fly over head towards the portland airport, port and starboard lights blinking, flying at a lower altitude, preparing to land at pdx... nothing abnormal there... then after that plane passed over head, a minute later i notice a really bright star travelling at quite a fast speed, and maybe a few hundred feet behind it another one followed. at this point i called to her and said "hey, what do you think that is?" (she is a plane buff) at first i thought maybe they were satellites or something, but my friend said that she knows what sats. look like as she used to sit out as a kid with her father and watch the satellites over heard. she said satellites are much more dimmer than what we saw. it was the brightest thing in the sky. she ran into the house to grab her binoculars, and i continued to watch these lights as they quickly traveled across the sky. as i watched, the first light started dimming, dimmed to the point where it just disappeared. when she came out, she handed me the binoculars and before i could track it, she said the other light did the same thing. there was no sound at all, and no other lights (no red or green lights), no blinking lights either. it was hard to gauge how high it was but she said it appeared to be pretty high up (around 30,000 feet). the next day after thinking about it, she rationalized that it was a military plane and the reason for the dimming light was the fov as it was passing us. it kind of made sense to me, but why at that altitude would both aircraft (traveling at the same speed) have those very bright lights and no port\starboard lights?) we talked it over for about 20 minutes on all the different possibilities, but nothing really seemed to be rational.
